title: ThunderBird2 - I want to continue using it or get involved into a TB2 Fork.
content:
Dear ThunderBird Users and Developers :)

I've been using Tunderbird for many years. I like its old good interface which it had till 2 version. Therefore, I want to continue using TB2 version or get involved into a TB2 Fork, in order to continue using the old good interface it has :) I'm using Debian Linux and to have TB2 I install it manually. Since Debian 9 two libraries have been removed libnspr4-0d and libnss3-1d. Therefore, I keep the last (old/deprecated) packages "libnspr4_4.12-2_amd64.deb", "libnspr4-0d_4.12-2_amd64.deb", "libnss3_3.26-1+debu8u11_amd64.deb" and "libnss3-1d_3.26-1+debu8u11_amd64.deb" so to install my favorite TB2 I must downgrade libnspr4 and libnss3. Who can I contact to get/build the new libnspr4-0d and libnss3-1d libraries which would allow to continue using TB2 without the need to decrease their parent packages libnspr4 and libnss3 to old versions (mentioned above)? Alternatively, I'm ready to get involved into making fork of TB2, to apply there all the missing improvements, but to allow having the old good interface which I like and would like to continue using. Or maybe there already is such a fork - then please let me know, where to find it and how to contact the responsible Developer/s. If needed I can describe in detail the whole procedure of my manual installation of TB2 @ Debian 12. Thanks in advance and kind regards~~Piotrek~~pe3no

title: Unified folders not working properly in version 102
content:

The three accounts are configured properly and I can use them without any issue.

But I have a problem with "Unified folders", that I do not think is working properly.

I set "View -> Folders -> Unified" in order to view all the messages in B and C accounts.

Problem: - In the "Inbox" folder under "Unified folders", I see only messages in C, I do not see the messages in B - If I select folder B: "Unified folders -> Inbox -> B" I can see the messages received in account B

I do not think this is normal behaviour. I have read various guides, but most of them are outdated and contain references to menu items that are no longer available.

I have made various tests in "Troubleshooting mode" and everything came up "sane".

start of file --------------

[Install8216C80C92C4E828] Default=D:\ThunderbirdMail Locked=1

[Profile2] Name=Ian Hobson IsRelative=0 Path=D:\ThunderbirdMail

title: Should return receipts be end to end encrypted as well
content:
I have two email addresses - on different email providers for testing purposes.

lets call these two email addresses alice at disroot dot org and bob at zohomail dot com (not my real email addresses)

Both email accounts are set up on the same machine with mozilla thunderbird. Both accounts have a valid gnu pg keys, created with mozilla thunderbird. Both accounts have open pgp enabled, and default to enabling encryption on new messages by default. Since both accounts are on the same thunderbird installation (and profile and yada yada), I have access to both public keys. When I send an email from one account to another, everything works fine. Replies are automatically encrypted as well. However, as far as I can tell, return receipts are NOT encrypted.

It is my guess that the return receipt is NOT encrypted because I am able to read the plain text message of the receipt in the zohomail web interface which I didn't give my keys. Snippet:

-- Note: This Return Receipt only acknowledges that the message was displayed on the recipient's computer. There is no guarantee that the recipient has read or understood the message contents. Reporting-UA: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:102.0) Gecko/20100101 Thunderbird/102.14.0 --

Is this intentional?

title: Before a Thunderbird Lightning event starts, how to send an email reminder(s)?
content:
Hi all Thunderbird enthousiast :)

In version 102, using the Lightning Calendar, when creating or editing a calendar event, how do I automatically send an email reminder(s) before the event start?

I tried. But Lightning "Set up Reminders" window offers only the "Show an alert" option. The number 6 in this screenshot shows the location of this challenge at https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-08-07-12-50-55-b4905f.png

What I need is, still in this screenshot above, 1 hour before this event starts, Lightning to automatically send an email message reminder to a preset email address(es).

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

Below is the same question as above. But with details if you're interested in those.

Steps to reproduce this challenge:

1. Using Thunderbird Lightning, click on the "Event" button to create a new Calendar event

2. The "New Event" window will open

3. Using this "New Event" window above, using its "Reminder" field, select the "Custom..." option. The numbers 1 et 2 in this screenshot show this at https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-08-07-12-49-18-5d2120.png

5. The "Set up Reminders" window will open

6. Using this "Set up Reminders" window above, open the "Choose a Reminder Action" menu. Lightning offers only the "Show an alert" option. This screenshot shows the location of this challenge at https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-08-07-12-50-55-b4905f.png

7. My question is this, 1 hour before this event starts, how to configure Lightning to automatically send an email message reminder(s) to a preset email address(es)?

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

Suggestion:

• If somehow Thunderbird version 102 is not yet able to send an email alert, then this is a suggestion for a new future. I'll try to create a new suggestion at https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas Then I'll try to add the link here. • I recall that in a previous version of Thunderbird Lightning, its "Set up Reminders" window offered multiples options to choose from. Including "Show an alert" or "Send an email message". Could part of the previous Thunderbird code be recycled for Thunderbird 102? • If needed, both me and the Ubertus.org team would be happy to contribute beta testing and documentation for this new feature. Any volunteer for a patch?

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

What I tried that did not work:

• Clicked on the "Choose a Reminder Action" drop down menu. Only one option is available. It reads "Display alert". • Double-checked that the calendar is a Network Calendar (CalDAV) • Double-checked that the calendar "Properties" as an email address associated to it • Added my email address to the list of Attendees. This does send email notifications. But only on Event creation or event changes. This is not what I need. What I need is, for exemple, 1 hour before an event start, send an email message to be automatically sent to a set email address(es). Assuming that during this period I leave my Thunderbird both open and connected. • Searched for add-on about email alert at https://addons.thunderbird.net/fr/thunderbird/extensions/ I found none able to send email alert before an event start.

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

Synonyms of calendar event email reminder:

• email alert • alarm mailing • reminder action • send email reminder • thunderbird notification by email message
creator: F8a

title: Can't import from previous profile after reinstalling Thunderbird 102
content:
Thunderbird suddenly stopped working this morning after it updated to 102.14; it wouldn't send or receive anything, even though nothing had changed. It kept popping up a browser window with a fixed URL asking me to login to my Yahoo! mail account. Except I couldn't because it kept telling me to allow cookies even though no cookies were blocked.

Finally tried reinstalling v102.12 and now it only sees some of the emails, so I tried to import those from the previous profile (which is the same number as the one I have now) and it won't do that, either. It claims two errors, which I can't fix, but the developers should have known about long ago:

Security Error: Content at chrome://messenger/skin/shared/tabmail.css may not load or link to moz-extension://d44a13e6-5a81-1240-aa57-f4a0b6f0568c/firefoxbanner11.png. 5;

and

Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at /Users/MacBoy/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/7v67w4i0.default/prefs.js

So, what am I supposed to do to get those emails back and get Thunderbird working again? It's still not retrieving anything; it just says 'null' when I click on Get Messages. And I'm still not able to see about 17,000 emails that were just there this morning.

Surely, the developers must know how to fix this; it's their program.

title: TAA Compliance
content:
Hello, I am seeking to get the latest version of Mozilla Thunderbird approved on my employer's enterprise. There is currently a big push to support American products so my job requires confirmation of Country of Origin, ie an official document or letter, from the software company to provide proof that any software requested is sourced from either the United States or friendly partners (https://gsa.federalschedules.com/resources/taa-designated-countries/)

If someone from Mozilla could provide an official letter to me confirming that Mozilla products are primarily developed and/or transformed in the US or its partners that would greatly appreciated as no new software will be approved without this.

Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions or concerns. Any document you provide can be emailed to sean.m.lee8.civ@mail.mil.

title: Junk filters: Body and Customized search not working
content:
Hello, I've been trying to filter some junk emails but no luck. The Subject, From, To, Etc. filters work as expected. However, a search on Body and/or Customized fields doesn't work. For example:

1) Body -> Contains -> sometext: This doesn't work at all, even for a word. I can find the email using the quick filter so I know the words are correct but the filter is not picking the emails up. I tried everything, phrases, words, numbers. Nothing works. I checked the source code of the emails and I can see the text right there so it is not a problem of formatting, encryption, Etc.

2) Customized -> X-Sender-IP -> is / Contains -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx: This doesn't work. I checked the source code of the emails and I can see the text right there so it is not a problem of formatting, encryption, Etc.

I also tried with Before and After junk email classification but that didn't make any difference.

The issue is that Sender, Subject are not good enough as they change every time and domains you cannot always block because some of them are actually valid.

I use filters with the Match Any Of The Following option.

Please advise.

Thanks.

Regards

title: Deleted emails do not appear in Trash folder

title: Comcast Outgoing Mail Server Setup
content:
I've used T'Bird for years. I have 6 Comcast e-mail addresses. I can receive e-mail on all of them.

BUT, maybe a month ago, maybe 2, I can now only send messages on ONE, my "main" C'Cast account. The one I sign in with @ xfinity.com, to manage all E addresses/accounts.

When send fails, I get a message saying:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Please ensure your email address and authenticating user match when sending messages. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.

So I dig into my T-Bird account settings. Each of the 6 addresses has individual settings on the "Incoming Server". When I look at "Outgoing Server", it's ONE setting (U/N & Pass) for ALL accounts", which has always been my Main CCast account! If I change one, they all change.

At Comcast, all E addresses use the same password, which is why it worked FLAWLESSLY for YEARS! Now, Comcast's server APPEARS to be looking for an INDIVIDUAL U/N & Pass for EACH address, which T-Bird appears to be NOT capable of doing.

Any recommendations??

Thanks & have a great day!!!

title: Printing emails in Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64-bit)
content:
Hi, I upgraded to the above version last week and I love it...until yesterday and today when I needed to print out a couple of different emails. Prior to upgrading to Supernova, I never had an issue with printing, now I do. Prior, if I clicked on what appeared to be a one page email, it would print out on one page, no issues. Now, if I try and print what should be a one page email, it previews as being three pages. Page one is the headers all by itself at the top of the page with the rest of the page as blank, page two shows as the body of the email, and then page three shows the footers of the email and the attachment list (if any). Why is it doing this and how can I get it back to printing everything on one page like it should be?

I have attached copies of what the pages look like as three pages instead of being on one page like it should be.

Thanks in advance.

title: Upgraded to Thunderbird 115: Calendar, contacts, and certs okay, but missing thousands of emails.
content:
Hello all,

One of our users' Thunderbird installations was recently updated from version 102.2.2 to 115.0.1.

At work, we use an offline network. We have no direct internet connection at all. We use a Microsoft Exchange mail server to handle inbound and outbound emails.

When our user got a new computer last week and first signed in to Thunderbird, her folder structure was correct, but something went wrong because her inbox and sent folders were completely empty. She would get a notification whenever someone sent her an email, but when she clicked on it, it would just show her an empty Thunderbird inbox (she should have thousands of messages).

I, and others, have verified her email server settings are correct and the same as on other systems not experiencing this issue.

Her calendar events, contacts, and email certificates are all where they should be. It's just her messages that are missing.

Now here's where it gets weirder. Having created a backup of her original Thunderbird profiles directory and profiles.ini file, I exited Thunderbird and removed those profile files/folder from her "C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird" directory. Upon restarting Thunderbird, it asked for her to log in. She used the address and username I verified were in the Exchange server, and upon signing in, her mail client synced all her messages correctly. However, as expected, her calendar and certificate info was still missing since those don't come from the Exchange server. So, when I close Thunderbird and put her original profiles back into the AppData\Roaming directory (adding, not replacing the new ones since that also doesn't work) and start Thunderbird, we're back at square one where she's got certificates, calendar events, and addresses, but no emails in the inbox or sent folders.

Has anyone seen this before?

P.S.: Sorry there are no photos. I can't post screenshots from any of our computers.
creator: mp956

title: Problem Converting Eudora emails to Thunderbird
content:
Hello everyone,

Here's my problem. After a couple years of messing around with Eudora replacements, I've decided to give TB another try. I've also been working with the Betterbird people a little (in case that matters).

I have thousands of emails still on my Eudora system, categorized by folders (2010 outbox, 2011 outbox...2022 outbox, 2022 inbox etc) and know where each of the mbx files are located.

In reading about converting, i've seen two suggestions:

1.) Use the IMPORTEXPORT add on - I tried this. It did not convert the emails into anything usable. It also looks like all attachments have been left behind. The emails ARE readable however...but not much more than that.

2.) Use an earlier version of TB to convert the old Eudora files - I had tried this a couple years ago. Using V15, I was able to convert many of the old files into usable TB files. But there are a few thousand that were NOT converted.

Here are my questions:

1.) using an earlier version of TB - how do i do this now, since I already have TB running? The instructions on how to do that are not clear. Can i load up the V15 version (again) while my current version is still running. It seems like this is a recipe for confusion.

2.) Is there any 3rd party software that makes this easier? - I've seen Corbell and one other software system advertised. I'm more interested in getting this done quickly than spending $50. This problem is holding up my final coversion from my present system (mailbird).

Thanks in advance for any insight on how to accomplish this.

Dean Calvert

title: Server mail.twc.com email suddenly won’t send from Thunderbird
content:
I have had Thunderbird installed on my Windows 10 computer for a long time and have experienced few difficulties, none for a year or so including no SMTP email sending difficulties using Spectrum’s mail.twc.com. I have the latest version of Thunderbird.

Nevertheless, when I sent several emails successfully and immediately tried to send another one, the send failed. I had made no email account changes at all—same setup as before.

Emails will send through web mail, but I much prefer using Thunderbird.

Here are the SMTP settings that have been in place for a long time: Description: AT&T; Server name: mail.twc.com; Port 587; User name: [my full and correct email address]; Authentication method: Normal password; and Connection security: STARTTLS.

I tried some changes a friend suggested to see what might happen—changing connection security to SSL/TLS and then to none, switching port to 465—but no improvement occurred.

This is the error notice that appears:

“Send Message Error

“Sending of the message failed. “The message could not be sent because connecting to the Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.twc.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) are correct and try again.”

I should mention that I have a Gmail account run through Thunderbird, which works fine (of course it has a different outgoing server). I also have waited a couple of hours to see if this might resolve itself, but it hasn’t done so, and I rebooted the computer, no change. If I call Spectrum, they undoubtedly will tell me it is Thunderbird’s problem.

What to do to resolve this?

title: Falha na autenticação com OAuth2 no Hotmail
content:
O e-mail principal do meu perfil parou de receber mensagens com o método de autenticação "Senha normal". Por outro lado, o Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64 bits) não pede a senha para autenticação com o método OAuth2.

Quando o sistema tenta receber mensagens, abre-se uma janela com a URL https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/v2.0/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=9e5f94bc-xxxx-4e73-b8be-63364c29d753&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost&scope=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FIMAP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FPOP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FSMTP.Send+offline_access&login_hint=xxxx%40hotmail.com, mas ela fecha automaticamente antes de carregar a página para colocar a senha e aparece a mensagem "uncaught exception: 2147500036" no console de erros.

Não existe um token OAuth2 desse e-mail salvo no local das senhas e o Thunderbird não aparece na lista de aplicativos autorizados na conta desse e-mail.

Observação: Algumas contas do Hotmail pediram a senha e estão funcionando corretamente com o método de autenticação OAuth2.

title: filters/rules handle messages differently
content:
Dear,

I am using some templates in my Thunderbird 115.1.0 for windows 11 that are AUTO-sent based on certain rules/filters. ie when a revieved e-mail contains a specific word in the message a rule will reply to the message using template 1.

I am now attaching a .gpx file with the template message. The message is sent as usual, but the attachement is not attached to the message (no attachement in the e-mail stored in sent-items). The message is recieved as an message with the added line: "This is a multi-part message in MIME format. --------------TwIF08u4BWQAhVjYA9nsShou Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit " Also a lot of asci-characters are in the message.

The strange this is: if I sent the very same template manually it all works like a charm. The message is sent with the GPX-file attached to it, and recieved with the complete and functioning attachement.

This leaves me to think Thunderbird handels message automatically differently from manually. Is there any way around this?

Looking forward to your response.

Kind regards.

creator: robin84

title: Timestamp-format when forwarding an email
content:
Hi, the following issue is pretty version independent. Happens as well in the 102.x as the new 115.x branch:

i have noticed, that every time I get an e-mail from outside my timezone, which is UTC+2, and I then want to forward this e-mail, the format of the forwarded date-header is different from what the timestamp is in my inbox. For example: I receive an e-mail on Thu, 24th May, 2012 at 17.57 (this is what is the timestamp in my inbox). I forward that e-mail, the date-header is Thu, 24 May 2012 08:57:20 -0700.

Well, UTC+2 and UTC-7 means 9 hours time shift. This is plausible, the person, which sent me that mail has his office somewhere in SFBA, so he will probably have started his day at around 8am and not long after have replied to me. So for me, the date-header in the forwarded message is valid, and the origin time of sender plausible.

How ever, I'd rather have also in the forwarded mail the translated local time then the origin-sender time + Timeshift. Not everybody can, want or has time to calculate timezones... So this is my question: Can I parametrize thunderbird, so that it displays the date-header in the localtime format so that it matches the one from my inbox?

Thank for your help, regards, Felix

Shutting down TB and reopening the same profile momentarily showing the words "Inbox", then shows "Address Book." As I am writing this now, I see "Address Book - Mozill..." on the Task Bar, but clicking on it does not take me there.

When navigating using Alt-Tab to rotate through the open programs, when I get to "Address Book," I can see a thumbnail of the address book, but it will not open when I try to stop there.

I found the three folders containing each profile's files. Comparing the three, all files seem to be present.

I need help badly, because this Personal profile has 99% of all my emails in it from four email addresses.

Thank you. Charles Wolf New York, NY [removed email and phone#'s from public support forum] P.S. I am picking up new emails directly from my provider (Network Solutions)

title: How to stop annoying "will no longer be hosted" uninstall alert on startup?
content:
This is a general question on TB behavior when a dev moves (or removes?) an extension from the normal addons.thunderbird.net repo to a different webspace, but immediately concerns a specific extension, ThunderbirdHTMLedit.

The author recently moved the official download location (to www.betterbird.eu/addons), and whether triggered by that action or some embedded code, an ultra-annoying popup now appears on each and every TB startup:

"Dear users, ThunderHTMLedit will no longer be hosted at addons.thunderbird.net. Please head to www.betterbird.eu/addons/ to install the new version. The extension “ThunderHTMLedit” is requesting to be uninstalled. What would you like to do?"

The only two options are "Keep installed" and "Uninstall." There is no checkbox for "Don't ask again," "Remember this decision," or "Never show this message again as long as humans walk the earth."

So is there a way to stop such alerts that won't break other things?

title: Do not want next message selected after deleting/archiving
content:
Before TB115, I used a plug-in called "Deselect on Delete" that would result in no message being selected after a message was deleted or archived.

With 115, when I delete or archive a message, the next one on the list (or previous one if deleting the message at the bottom of the list) is highlighted and marked Read. This causes me to skip over the message, thinking I've already read it. Very inconvenient, can't imagine how it's not an issue to other users.

I've seen other solutions that suggest toggling F8 to hide the preview pane. However, the next message is still selected, but not marked Read. Upon toggling F8 again, the selected message is then marked Read, making this not an optimal solution.

I was tempted to revert back to an older version, but my profile is no longer compatible. Hopefully there is a fix for this.

Thanks! - Robert

title: Unable to easily access "Description" field of calendar event in order to click on Zoom meeting links
content:
I am having trouble accessing the "Description" field of calendar events, which is making it difficult to click on Zoom links in the Description of the event. It seems like there are two things that could be improved that would allow me to access the Description more easily:

1. When I mouse hover over an event in the calendar, the description field appears and I can see the zoom link. However, if I move my mouse off the event and over to the zoom link, the pop-up window with the description disappears. If this description pop-up window could stay around when I move over to it (or perhaps if one single-clicks on the event, then this pop-up window could stay around), then one could click on the zoom event. 2. When I double click on an event, I can normally see all the fields of the calendar event. However, when the "General" and the "Attendees" fields are very long, then the "Description" field doesn't fit within the window, and I cannot find a way to scroll down to it. If one were able to scroll on the "event details" window, then I would be able to access the "Details" field and I could click on my zoom link.

If either (or ideally both) of the above issues have a solution, then that would solve my issue with accessing zoom links in the Description of events. I am a new user of Thunderbird, so if there's a feature or add-on that I'm unaware of that addresses the above issues, then I would be happy to hear about it. I wasn't able to find something on my own though. If there are any more details that I could provide to help describe my issue, then please let me know.

Thunderbird version: 115.1.0 (64-bit) macOS version: 13.4.1 (c)
creator: zachary.p.potter

title: SMTP server timing out (smtp.office365.com) sometimes...
content:
Hi all,

I've been experiencing an issue for the past 8 weeks after the organization have migrated to Office 365.

I've tried all the steps listed in this article, https://support.mozilla.org/bm/kb/cannot-send-messages#w_if-this-list-..., "Cannot send messages". Tips include removing account and adding it again, deleting SMTP password, trying both ports 587 and 465, and of course verifying my SMTP outgoing email settings multiple times.

The issue is, sometimes it works perfectly fine to send e-mails. Sometimes it doesn't - it can take up to 5-10 secs for the e-mail to be sent.

I've also tried:

1) Increasing Server Timeout Value in the Config Editor 2) Disabled Anti-virus briefly to find that the issue was still there

This is the e-mail box that is showing: https://bilddump.se/bilder/20230815112202-84.55.121.202.png

This is my Office365 SMTP settings: https://bilddump.se/bilder/20230815112041-84.55.121.202.png

Questions:

- Is anyone else experiencing issues sending e-mails with Office365 smtp settings? - Before migrating to Office365, sending e-mails was super quick. Now, it takes 2-5 secs for each e-mail to be sent. However, SOMETIMES, it sends super quick... How come? - Does Office365 have general issues with Thunderbird? Using other e-mail clients such as Spark+ our Outlook doesn't give this issue, but I really want to use Thunderbird as it's been my go-to email client for multiple years

Hoping for a resolution... if anyone has experience with TB and Office365 having this issue, happy for any tips to try so I can start sending emails quick again.
